unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi reported a surge in neurology cases this week, particularly affecting young adults. Dr. Rajesh Kumar, Head of Neurology, mentioned a 20% increase in patients complaining of severe headaches and unexplained dizziness. Many attribute this to increased screen time and stress levels linked to WFH culture, especially post-COVID.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi reported a surge in neurology cases this week, particularly affecting young adults. Doctor Rajesh Kumar, Head of Neurology, mentioned a twenty percent increase in patients complaining of severe headaches and unexplained dizziness. Many attribute this to increased screen time and stress levels linked to W-F-H culture, especially post-C-O-V-I-D.

unnormalised: Neurologists are observing a worrying trend of younger people developing conditions typically seen in older demographics. "We're seeing more cases of migraine, even some early signs of Parkinson's, among the 25-35 age group," Dr. Sharma stated. Experts recommend regular breaks, proper posture, and limiting screen time to combat these issues. Patients are advised to consult a neurologist if symptoms persist beyond 72 hrs.
normalised: Neurologists are observing a worrying trend of younger people developing conditions typically seen in older demographics. "We're seeing more cases of migraine, even some early signs of Parkinson's, among the twenty five to thirty five age group," Doctor Sharma stated. Experts recommend regular breaks, proper posture, and limiting screen time to combat these issues. Patients are advised to consult a neurologist if symptoms persist beyond seventy two hours.

unnormalised: Common diagnostic procedures like EEG (Rs. 2500) and MRI scans (Rs. 6000) are in high demand, leading to longer wait times at various hospitals across the city. Apollo Hospital has added two more neurologists to their team to handle the increasing patient load. The ministry of health is considering launching awareness campaigns to promote preventative measures.

unnormalised: This surge highlights the need for greater awareness about neurological health and the importance of lifestyle modifications. Regular checkups, even if you feel fine, are advisable, esp. if there's a family history of neurological disorders. Remember, health is wealth, bhai!
